story:
Who We Are . . . 

  • Kore Theatre Project is a brand new company conceived by current students of the Stella Adler Studio of Acting. Kore Theatre Project aims to inspire, thrill, and educate audiences with productions that range from classics to new works. With a keen interest in physical theatre and a passion for Greek mythologies, this company hopes to ignite the imagination of the American theatre community with our innovative productions and original devised work. We strive to develop the minds and bodies of the next theatre generation.    
  • This campaign will fund Kore Theatre Project's Inaugural production of Sarah Ruhl's Eurydice. Eurydice will premiere this August at the Bandshell in Jackie Robinson Park on 84 Bradhurst Ave, New York, New York. The performances will take place at 7 pm on August 14,15,16, & 17. Directed by Kore Theatre Project's Artistic Director, Elizabeth Lanier, this production will deal with love, memory, and what happens when we choose to gamble with fate. As a company, we are looking to reinvest in the actor's imagination. Therefore, this will be a minimalist production and the atmospheric elements will be entirely created by the actors' bodies and voices. Our fantastic cast is comprised of recent graduates as well as current students of the Stella Adler Studio of Acting: 

    Eurydice.....................Ajna Jaisinghani

    Her Father.................Greg Pragel

    Orpheus......................Dustin Teuber

    A Nasty Interesting Man/ The Lord of the Underworld.................George Bull

    Little Stone................Palmyra Mattner

    Big Stone....................Sara Witter

    Loud Stone.................Frederika Reinhardt 

  • This production's Movement Coach is founding member and artistic associate, Cely Rivera. Our Music Director is artistic associate, Palmyra Mattner, who will also be playing the role of Little Stone! 

  • By contributing to this campaign, you are enabling young artists to create innovative work which is easily accessible to the New York community. Additionally, you are helping Kore Theatre Project get started from the ground up!  

What We Need & What You Get . . . 

  • We need to raise a minimum of $1,576 to cover the basic costs of this production. The more we raise, the better the show! Below is a breakdown of our budget: 

  • $500- covers the cost of rights for Eurydice ($125 x 4 nights)

    $700- covers the cost of the actors' stipends ($100 x 7 actors)

    $200- covers the cost of props, set pieces, and promotional materials

    $150- covers the cost of costume materials

    $25.62- covers the cost of the permit fee for Jackie Robinson Park

  • Kore Theatre Project is offering an exciting and numerous variety of perks to reward your contributions. Our perks range from guaranteed tickets, to fun souvenirs, to donor recognition. Our donor recognition is divided into three categories: Foundation Members, Members of Polis, and Goddesses or Gods! 
  • Foundation members receive two guaranteed tickets and mention in the program. 
  • Members of Polis receive three guaranteed tickets, mention in the program, and are invited to Kore Theatre Project's monthly Polis meetings where artists discuss current issues in science, politics, and art while brainstorming ideas for upcoming devised and collaborative work. 
  • Goddesses and Gods receive four guaranteed tickets, mention in the program, an invitation to monthly Polis meetings, and are listed on our company's website as producing contributors. The highest level of Gods, the Olympians, are invited to join the board of Kore Theatre Project.    
  • If our goal is not met, all donations will still go toward Kore Theatre Project's production of Sarah Ruhl's Eurydice.

Why . . .

  • We guarantee this production will excite your own imagination with a fresh take on this beautiful, classic piece of Greek mythology.   
  • Kore Theatre Project has future goals of devising our own collaborative work as well as developing original material and adaptations by emerging playwrights. We want to foster a dialogue between classic and contemporary story-telling by creating work that is relevant to what's going on in the world today!
  • Our company is unique in that our monthly Polis invites a wide variety of artists and thinkers to have an open and creative forum. That means YOU can have a direct impact on future work we choose to produce.

Other Ways You Can Help . . .

Help us spread the word about performances of Eurydice and our fundraising! Make some noise! Follow us! Like us!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/koretheatreproject 

Website: http://www.koretheatreproject.org/ 

AND COME SEE OUR SHOWS, see below for our performance schedule. We would love to see you!

All Performances are Pay-What- You-Can!!

All PERFORMANCES @ 7:00pm

Rain Policy: The show must go on! We perform rain or shine. We will never cancel a show before showtime. So come on out! Bring a slicker, bring an umbrella, bring a water repellent friend.  

  • August 14, 15, 16, & 17 - The Bandshell in Jackie Robinson Park: 84 Bradhurst Ave, New York, New York.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!

story:
We at Eleusyve Productions are currently working on our 5th full length rock opera based upon the seven planetary theatrical rituals that comprise Aleister Crowley's Rites of Eleusis. The Rite of Mars, our current project, will be staged September 5th, 6th, 11th, 12th and 13th in Seattle, WA, and with ample support we will stage additional performances in Portland and Spokane.

Many of you have supported us in the past, for which we are extremely grateful. We are pleased to announce that this time Eleusyve Productions is under the fiscal sponsorship of Shunpike, and as such your gifts are tax deductible.  

Donations totaling $4900.00 will allow us to perform The Rite of Mars in Seattle.  

With an additional $1800.00 we will have enough to stage the Rite in Spokane, WA.  

An additional $2300.00 beyond that will cover the presentation in Portland, OR.

The money we collect through Indiegogo will be used to cover the cost of rehearsal space, theater rental, insurance, sets, props, costumes and advertising for the production.

These stage performances are recorded and edited for DVD and released to the public as part of our ongoing effort at Eleusyve Productions to make Aleister Crowley's Rites of Eleusis more accessible to a broader audience. To this end, we use music, light, dance, and drama to enhance the poetry and symmetry of the original works.

Watch scenes from The Rite of Sol, The Rite of Mercury, The Rite of Venus and The Rite of Luna on YouTube.

For more information about Eleusyve Productions please visit our website, or enjoy these reviews of our past productions of The Rite of Venus and The Rite of Mercury.

You can also help fund our projects by purchasing copies of previous sound tracks and DVDs from Eleusyve!

Thank you!

story:
Clicca qui per la versione ITALIANA

Click aqui para la version en ESPAÑOL

Short Summary 

Help us  bring our show to The Edinburgh Free Fringe and continue creating and devising Ideas Worth  a Penny!

We need your help to produce our first show, The Virgin and the Lamb,  where Mary and Jesus are satirical characters played by two outcasts who surrender everything for their dream to fly with a low cost airline.  They entertain the audience by making fun of society while asking the question: is it worth the sacrifice to follow society's idea of what is right?

Our brand new company, Ideas Worth a Penny, is an international cast of performers who were brought together in Paris at Ecole Philippe Gaulier. Carmen Arquelladas(Spain), Simone Tani(Italy), Miwa Nagai(Japan) and Duncan Cameron (Canada) are interested with focusing on themes through Bouffon, which questions the importance of the mainstream belief of happiness, and gives a point of view to the outcasts and those who have been rejected from society. These people come back from their shadows to show us the truths in the lies that we build our lives upon. 

The Virgin and the Lamb, a highly original and subversive bouffon show combining darkly funny sketch with song, comedy and satire,  will be presented at the Balham Fringe Festival and at the Edinburgh Free Fringe Festival. 

The first showings of bits of our show in London has been very successful, we need your help to go further.

With your funding you can help us to move our first steps as a company and take our work at the biggest theatre festival in Europe.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising £2,200 which constitutes a portion of the budget for our show. At the moment this production has been funded entirely by our sweat.

Firstly, what we rise will go to rehearsal space, that will help us continue our work in a creative atmosphere. As well as taking the pressure off of our budget for costume and props, travel costs and accommodation in Edinburgh.  Your funding would give us more freedom to develop ideas that would have otherwise been out of our price range. We then would be able to look into the option of  creating a higher quality promotional video along with flyers that will aid us to be seen among the many other shows in Edinburgh Fringe Festival. Having a good promotional pack will open doors to future opportunities and help us grow as a company.

Your help, is vital even a small donation can make a big difference.


The Impact

With your contribution you'll give legs to a brand new international theatre company. Your support is vital for us in this moment, because budget for brand new theatre companies is a great challenge. 

With your contribution you'll help us to give a voice to the societies rejects. We like to lead the audience through a short journey of self doubt and questioning. Also showing them how people regarded as awful, and not even worth the pity, can show the beauty of humanity. How do they see what is regarded as important for life and happiness? How do they parody these beliefs?

We are also looking to create theatrical experiences where we involve, and arouse, laughing from the audience as well as a sickening feeling that they are not innocent. We explore themes such as the maltreatment of elderly, by exposing care home abuse. Gay exclusion, by revealing homophobia, and racism by presenting differences in cultural beliefs.  As these themes can be quite risky and heavy, we work a lot with humor to keep the scenes light in appearance but deep in concept, this is something we are proud of and we hope to get your support to keep developing it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Help our voice reaching as many people as possible. This is also a concrete way you can contribute to this campaign. Please take a moment to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and all other social networks. Please invite your peers to donate and to watch the show. 



ITALIAN

In breve

Aiutaci a portare il nostro spettacolo al Free Fringe Festival di Edimburgo ed ad avviare la nostra compagnia: Ideas Worth a Penny!

Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per produrre il nostro primo spettacolo, "The Virgin and the Lamb" (La Vergine e l'Agnelllo), in cui Maria e Gesù sono due personaggi satirici, interpretati da due emarginati, che abbandonano tutto per il sogno di volare con una compagnia aerea low-cost. Intrattengono il pubblico prendendo in giro la società e ponendo la domanda: vale la pena di sacrificare la propria vita per seguire ciò che la società ci dice essere giusto e degno di valore?

La nostra neonata compagnia, Ideas Worth a Penny, è composta da un cast internazionaleche si è formato a Parigi all scuola Ecole Philippe Gaulier: Carmen Arquelladas(Spagna), Simone Tani(Italia), Miwa Nagai(Giappone) e Duncan Cameron (Canada). Siamo interessati alle tematiche di solito affrontate con la tecnica del "buffone", che mette in discussione l'importanza di quanto dato per scontato dalla società come giusto da perseguire e fonte di felicità. Il buffone fornisce il punto di vista degli esclusi e degli emarginati. Questi personaggi escono dall'ombra, in cui sono invitati a stare, per metter in luce la verità tra le maglie  delle bugie su cui è costruita la nostra società.

"The Virgin and the Lamb", è uno spettacolo originale e sovversivo che combina umorismo nero, sketch comici musicali e satira. Sarà presentato in anteprima al Balham Fringe Festival a Londra ed al Free Fringe Festival di Edimburgo.

Abbiamo mostrato alcune brevi parti dello spettacolo in diversi cabaret a Londra ed è stato un successo. Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per continuare e arricchire lo spettacolo di nuovi contenuti e presentarlo al più grande festival teatrale in Europa.


Di cosa abbiamo bisogno ed i premi per te

Stiamo raccogliendo £2,200 che costituiscono parte degli investimenti necessari per portare lo spettacolo a Edimburgo. Al momento la produzione è stata finanziata con i nostri sacrifici e con il nostro lavoro.

Quanto raccolto, come prima cosa andrà a finanziare il costo delle sale prove, per permetterci di continuare lo sviluppo dello spettacolo in un atmosfera creativa. Inoltre ci permetterà di allentare la pressione sul budget per i costumi e gli oggetti di scena, le spese di viaggio e alloggio a Edimburgo. Il tuo supporto ci renderà più liberi di sviluppare idee che sarebbero altrimenti fuori dalla nostra portata dal punto di vista finanziario. Inoltre saremmo in grado di creare un video promozionale di buona qualità e dei volantini che ci permettano di essere visibili tra la marea di spettacoli presenti al Fringe Festival. Un buon pacchetto promozionale ci aprirebbe le porte per accedere a opportunità future e ci permetterebbe di crescere come compagnia.

Se doni riceverai un piccolo segno della nostra riconoscenza ecco la lista dei premi disponibili:

- 5 sterline: Check-in

Un sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.


- 15 sterline: Allaccia le cinture

Sei un performer? Se si, ti garantiamo:

Un sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.

Un retweet due volte alla settimane, per 3 settimane, delle info sul tuo spettacolo.


- 30 sterline: Carta d'imbarco

Un sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.

Una cartolina scritta e firmata dal cast dello spettacolo.


- 50 sterline: Controllo del Passaporto

un messaggio d'amore su  Facebook e Twitter.

Un foto-messaggio di ringraziamento del cast, con il costume di scena, da Edimburgo.


- 100 sterline: Fanfara d'atterraggio

un messaggio d'amore su  Facebook e Twitter.

Un video-messaggio di ringraziamento del cast, con il costume di scena, da Edimburgo.


- 500 sterline: Business class

Sarai il nostro sponsor principale. Ti citeremo come sponsor su facebook e twitter, inseriremo i tuoi loghi sulle copertine dei nostri social media e nella homepage del nostro sito.


- 1000 sterline: Scuola di volo

Uno spettacolo ed un workshop su come mettere in scena uno spettacolo in stile "bouffon" presso il tuo teatro.  Al workshop puoi invitare un massimo di 16 partecipanti. Noi siamo basati a Londra e Bristol, nel caso in cui la tua compagnia risieda in un'altra città dovremmo negoziare il rimborso delle spese.

Il tuo aiuto è vitale. Anche una donazione minima può fare la differenza.


L'impatto

Con il tuo contributo darai gambe ed ali ad una nuova compagnia teatrale internazionale. Il tuo supporto è essenziale per noi in questo momento. perché la formazione di un budget per una nuova compagnia teatrale costituisce una sfida durissima.

Con il tuo contributo ci aiuterai a dar voce ai reietti. Ci piace accompagnare il nostro pubblico in un viaggio fatto di dubbio e messa in discussione di ogni aspetto della società. Ci piace mostrare come le persone etichettate come orribili ed indegne anche della pietà. Come vedono, dal loro punto di vista, ciò che è considerato importante nella vita e foriero di felicità. Come parodiano queste certezze?

Siamo impegnati in una ricerca che ci porti a creare esperienze teatrali in cui coinvolgere, provocare e far ridere il pubblico ma al tempo stesso creare un senso di disagio e la sensazione di non essere innocenti. Esploriamo temi sociali come il maltrattamento degli anziani esponendo gli abusi nelle case di cura; l'esclusione sociale degli omosessuali, smascherando l'omofobia; il razzismo presentando le differenze ed i pregiudizi nelle varie culture.
Siccome questi temi possono essere molto rischiosi e pesanti, lavoriamo con umorismo al fine di realizzare scene in apparenza leggere ma con concetti profondi. Aiamo orgogliosi del nostro lavoro e speriamo di avere il tuo supporto per continuare a svilupparlo.



Altri modi in cui ci puoi aiutare

Aiutaci a fare arrivare la nostra il più lontano possibile. Un modo concreto per aiutarci consiste nel dedicare un momento del tuo tempo a condividere questa campagna su Facebook, su Twitter o su altri social media.
Per favore invita i tuoi contatti a donare e ad andare a vedere il nostro spettacolo.



SPANISH

Breve Resumen 


Ayúdanos a llevar nuestro espectáculo al Free Fringe Festival de Edimburgo y seguir creando nuestra compañía: Ideas Worth a Penny.

Necesitamos tu ayuda para poder producir nuestro primer espectáculo, La Virgen y el Cordero. Una obra donde María y Jesús son  satíricos personajes interpretados por  marginados de la sociedad, que sacrifican todo por el sueño de volar con una compañía de bajo coste. Entretienen al público riéndose de la sociedad mientras formulan la pregunta: ¿vale la pena sacrificar la vida por lo que la sociedad dice que es justo y digno?

Nuestra nueva compañía, Ideas Worth a Penny, está compuesta por actores internacionales que se formaron juntos en la Escuela de Philippe Gaulier en Paris, Carmen Arquelladas (España), Simone Tani (Italia), Miwa Nagai (Japón) y Duncan Cameron (Cánada) estamos interesados en tratar los temas a través de la técnica del ¨Bouffon¨, que pone en duda lo que la sociedad da por sentado como búsqueda de la felicidad, y da el punto de vista de los excluidos y marginados. Estos personajes salen de las sombras en las que se les pidió estar para poner luz en las verdades que fueron escondidas tras las mentiras que construyó la sociedad.

“La Virgen y el Cordero” es un espectáculo original y subversivo que combina humor negro, sketch cómico y musicales con la sátira. Será presentado en el Balham Fringe Festival y en el Free Fringe de Edimburgo.

Hemos representado partes del espectáculo en diferentes cabarets en Londres y el resultado ha sido bastante satisfactorio. Necesitamos tu ayuda para continuar y mejorar nuestro trabajo y llevarlo al festival más grande de teatro de Europa.


Qué Necesitamos y Qué Consigues 


Estamos recaudando £ 2200, que constituye una parte del presupuesto para nuestro espectáculo. Hasta ahora, esta producción ha sido financiada en su totalidad por nuestro trabajo y esfuerzo

Lo recaudado lo utilizaremos primeramente para cubrir los gastos de los locales de ensayo, que nos ayudará a continuar con el desarrollo de nuestro trabajo en un ambiente creativo. También nos permite aliviar la presión sobre el presupuesto para los trajes y accesorios, gastos de viaje y alojamiento en Edimburgo. Tu apoyo nos hará más libres para desarrollar ideas que de otra manera estarían fuera de nuestro  presupuesto. Además, nos gustaría ser capaces de crear un video promocional de  buena calidad y los folletos que nos permitan promocionar nuestro espectáculo entre toda la marea de obras del Fringe Festival. Un buen paquete promocional nos abrirá las puertas para futuras oportunidades y nos permitirá crecer como compañía.

Tu ayuda es vital, incluso si es una pequeña donación puede crear una gran diferencia.

Si donas, también recibirás una pequeña muestra de nuestra gratitud. Aquí están los premios:


- 5 Pounds:Check-in

Un renombrado agradecimiento en Facebook y Twitter


- 15 Pounds:Abróchese el cinturón

¿Eres un artista? Si es así, te garantizamos:

Un renombrado agradecimiento en Facebook y Twitter

Un retweet dos veces a la semana, durante 3 semanas, con la información de tu espectáculo.


- 30 Pounds:Tarjeta de embarque

Un renombrado agradecimiento en Facebook y Twitter

Una postal escrita y firmada por los actores del espectáculo.


- 50 Pounds:Control del Pasaporte

Un mensaje de amor en  Facebook y Twitter.

Una Foto-Mensaje de agradecimiento de los actores con el vestuario de escena desde Edimburgo.


- 100 Pounds:Fanfarria de aterrizaje

Un mensaje de amor en  Facebook y Twitter.

Un video-mensaje de agradecimiento de los actores con el vestuario de escena desde Edimburgo.


- 500 Pounds:Business class

Serás nuestro principal  sponsor. Te  nombraremos como sponsor en facebook e twitter, pondremos tu logo en las portadas de nuestros medios sociales y pagina web.


- 1000 Pounds:Escuela de vuelo

Un espectáculo y un curso de fin de semana sobre cómo poner en escena una obra de “Bouffon” para tu compañía de teatro. Cupo máximo de 16 participantes. Nuestra base está en Londres y Bristol, en el caso de que se solicite otra ciudad se negociará el reembolso de los gastos de viaje.


El Impacto 


Con tu contribución nos estás ayudando a poner los pilares a nuestra nueva e internacional compañía de teatro. Tu ayuda es vital para nosotros en este momento, ya que conseguir  presupuesto para las nuevas compañías de teatro es un gran reto.

Con tu contribución nos ayudarás a dar voz a los marginados.

Nos gusta guiar al público por un viaje de dudas y preguntas sobre la sociedad actual. Nos gusta mostrar como las personas consideradas como horribles e indignas pueden mostrar la belleza de la humanidad. Cómo ven lo que se considera importante para la vida y la felicidad. Cómo parodian estas creencias.

Nos dedicamos a la investigación que nos lleve a crear experiencias teatrales que nos involucren, provoquen  y hagan reír al público, pero al mismo tiempo creen una sensación de incomodidad  y un sentimiento de no ser inocente. Exploramos temas sociales como el abuso de ancianos en las residencias, la exclusión social de los homosexuales revenado la homofobia; el racismo representado por las diferencias entre las distintas creencias culturales.

Dado que estos temas pueden ser muy arriesgados y duros, trabajamos con el humor  a fin de realizar  escenas de apariencia ligera pero con unos conceptos profundos. Estamos orgullosos de nuestro trabajo y esperamos contar con tu apoyo para continuar con su desarrollo.


Otras Formas De Ayudar


Ayúdanos a llevar nuestra voz lo más lejos posible. De una forma concreta puedes contribuir con nuestra campaña compartiéndola en Facabook, Twitter y otros medios sociales. Solo toma un momento. Por favor, invita a tus contactos a donar y a asistir a nuestro espectáculo.

Gracias!
story_txt:
Clicca qui per la versione ITALIANA Click aqui para la version en ESPAÑOL
Short Summary Help us  bring our show to The Edinburgh Free Fringe and continue creating and devising Ideas Worth  a Penny!We need your help to produce our first show, The Virgin and the Lamb,  where Mary and Jesus are satirical characters played by two outcasts who surrender everything for their dream to fly with a low cost airline.  They entertain the audience by making fun of society while asking the question: is it worth the sacrifice to follow society's idea of what is right?Our brand new company, Ideas Worth a Penny, is an international cast of performers who were brought together in Paris at Ecole Philippe Gaulier. Carmen Arquelladas(Spain), Simone Tani(Italy), Miwa Nagai(Japan) and Duncan Cameron (Canada) are interested with focusing on themes through Bouffon, which questions the importance of the mainstream belief of happiness, and gives a point of view to the outcasts and those who have been rejected from society. These people come back from their shadows to show us the truths in the lies that we build our lives upon. The Virgin and the Lamb, a highly original and subversive bouffon show combining darkly funny sketch with song, comedy and satire,  will be presented at the Balham Fringe Festival and at the Edinburgh Free Fringe Festival. The first showings of bits of our show in London has been very successful, we need your help to go further.With your funding you can help us to move our first steps as a company and take our work at the biggest theatre festival in Europe.What We Need & What You GetWe are raising £2,200 which constitutes a portion of the budget for our show. At the moment this production has been funded entirely by our sweat.Firstly, what we rise will go to rehearsal space, that will help us continue our work in a creative atmosphere. As well as taking the pressure off of our budget for costume and props, travel costs and accommodation in Edinburgh.  Your funding would give us more freedom to develop ideas that would have otherwise been out of our price range. We then would be able to look into the option of  creating a higher quality promotional video along with flyers that will aid us to be seen among the many other shows in Edinburgh Fringe Festival. Having a good promotional pack will open doors to future opportunities and help us grow as a company.Your help, is vital even a small donation can make a big difference.The ImpactWith your contribution you'll give legs to a brand new international theatre company. Your support is vital for us in this moment, because budget for brand new theatre companies is a great challenge. With your contribution you'll help us to give a voice to the societies rejects. We like to lead the audience through
a short journey of self doubt and questioning. Also showing them how
people regarded as awful, and not even worth the pity, can show the
beauty of humanity. How do they see what is regarded as important for
life and happiness?  How do they parody these beliefs?
We
are also looking to create theatrical experiences where we involve,
and arouse, laughing from the audience as well as a sickening feeling
that they are not innocent.  We explore themes such as the
maltreatment of elderly, by exposing care home abuse. Gay exclusion,
by revealing homophobia, and racism by presenting differences in
cultural beliefs.  As these themes can be quite risky and heavy, we
work a lot with humor to keep the scenes light in appearance but deep
in concept, this is something we are proud of and we hope to get your support to keep developing it. 
Other Ways You Can HelpHelp our voice reaching as many people as possible. This is also a concrete way you can contribute to this campaign. Please take a moment to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and all other social networks. Please invite your peers to donate and to watch the show. ITALIAN In breve
Aiutaci a portare il nostro spettacolo al Free Fringe Festival di Edimburgo ed ad avviare la nostra compagnia: Ideas Worth a Penny!Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per produrre il nostro primo spettacolo, "The Virgin and the Lamb" (La Vergine e l'Agnelllo), in cui Maria e Gesù sono due personaggi satirici, interpretati da due emarginati, che abbandonano tutto per il sogno di volare con una compagnia aerea low-cost. Intrattengono il pubblico prendendo in giro la società e ponendo la domanda: vale la pena di sacrificare la propria vita per seguire ciò che la società ci dice essere giusto e degno di valore?La nostra neonata compagnia, Ideas Worth a Penny, è composta da un cast internazionaleche si è formato a Parigi all scuola Ecole Philippe Gaulier: Carmen Arquelladas(Spagna), Simone Tani(Italia), Miwa Nagai(Giappone) e Duncan Cameron (Canada). Siamo interessati alle tematiche di solito affrontate con la tecnica del "buffone", che mette in discussione l'importanza di quanto dato per scontato dalla società come giusto da perseguire e fonte di felicità. Il buffone fornisce il punto di vista degli esclusi e degli emarginati. Questi personaggi escono dall'ombra, in cui sono invitati a stare, per metter in luce la verità tra le maglie  delle bugie su cui è costruita la nostra società."The Virgin and the Lamb", è uno spettacolo originale e sovversivo che combina umorismo nero, sketch comici musicali e satira. Sarà presentato in anteprima al Balham Fringe Festival a Londra ed al Free Fringe Festival di Edimburgo. Abbiamo mostrato alcune brevi parti dello spettacolo in diversi cabaret a Londra ed è stato un successo. Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per continuare e arricchire lo spettacolo di nuovi contenuti e presentarlo al più grande festival teatrale in Europa.Di cosa abbiamo bisogno ed i premi per te
Stiamo raccogliendo £2,200 che costituiscono parte degli investimenti necessari per portare lo spettacolo a Edimburgo. Al momento la produzione è stata finanziata con i nostri sacrifici e con il nostro lavoro.Quanto raccolto, come prima cosa andrà a finanziare il costo delle sale prove, per permetterci di continuare lo sviluppo dello spettacolo in un atmosfera creativa. Inoltre ci permetterà di allentare la pressione sul budget per i costumi e gli oggetti di scena, le spese di viaggio e alloggio a Edimburgo. Il tuo supporto ci renderà più liberi di sviluppare idee che sarebbero altrimenti fuori dalla nostra portata dal punto di vista finanziario. Inoltre saremmo in grado di creare un video promozionale di buona qualità e dei volantini che ci permettano di essere visibili tra la marea di spettacoli presenti al Fringe Festival. Un buon pacchetto promozionale ci aprirebbe le porte per accedere a opportunità future e ci permetterebbe di crescere come compagnia.Se doni riceverai un piccolo segno della nostra riconoscenza ecco la lista dei premi disponibili:- 5 sterline: Check-inUn sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.- 15 sterline: Allaccia le cintureSei un performer? Se si, ti garantiamo:Un sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.Un retweet due volte alla settimane, per 3 settimane, delle info sul tuo spettacolo.- 30 sterline: Carta d'imbarcoUn sentito ringraziamento su  Facebook e Twitter.Una cartolina scritta e firmata dal cast dello spettacolo.- 50 sterline: Controllo del Passaportoun messaggio d'amore su  Facebook e Twitter.Un foto-messaggio di ringraziamento del cast, con il costume di scena, da Edimburgo.- 100 sterline: Fanfara d'atterraggioun messaggio d'amore su  Facebook e Twitter.Un video-messaggio di ringraziamento del cast, con il costume di scena, da Edimburgo.- 500 sterline: Business class Sarai il nostro sponsor principale. Ti citeremo come sponsor su facebook e twitter, inseriremo i tuoi loghi sulle copertine dei nostri social media e nella homepage del nostro sito.- 1000 sterline: Scuola di voloUno spettacolo ed un workshop su come mettere in scena uno spettacolo in stile "bouffon" presso il tuo teatro.  Al workshop puoi invitare un massimo di 16 partecipanti. Noi siamo basati a Londra e Bristol, nel caso in cui la tua compagnia risieda in un'altra città dovremmo negoziare il rimborso delle spese.Il tuo aiuto è vitale. Anche una donazione minima può fare la differenza.L'impattoCon il tuo contributo darai gambe ed ali ad una nuova compagnia teatrale internazionale. Il tuo supporto è essenziale per noi in questo momento. perché la formazione di un budget per una nuova compagnia teatrale costituisce una sfida durissima.Con il tuo contributo ci aiuterai a dar voce ai reietti. Ci piace accompagnare il nostro pubblico in un viaggio fatto di dubbio e messa in discussione di ogni aspetto della società. Ci piace mostrare come le persone etichettate come orribili ed indegne anche della pietà. Come vedono, dal loro punto di vista, ciò che è considerato importante nella vita e foriero di felicità. Come parodiano queste certezze?Siamo impegnati in una ricerca che ci porti a creare esperienze teatrali in cui coinvolgere, provocare e far ridere il pubblico ma al tempo stesso creare un senso di disagio e la sensazione di non essere innocenti. Esploriamo temi sociali come il maltrattamento degli anziani esponendo gli abusi nelle case di cura; l'esclusione sociale degli omosessuali, smascherando l'omofobia; il razzismo presentando le differenze ed i pregiudizi nelle varie culture.Siccome questi temi possono essere molto rischiosi e pesanti, lavoriamo con umorismo al fine di realizzare scene in apparenza leggere ma con concetti profondi. Aiamo orgogliosi del nostro lavoro e speriamo di avere il tuo supporto per continuare a svilupparlo. Altri modi in cui ci puoi aiutare
Aiutaci a fare arrivare la nostra il più lontano possibile. Un modo concreto per aiutarci consiste nel dedicare un momento del tuo tempo a condividere questa campagna su Facebook, su Twitter o su altri social media.Per favore invita i tuoi contatti a donare e ad andare a vedere il nostro spettacolo.

story:
Or cirque

Bonjour,

comme vous le savez peut-être, ou comme vous allez l'apprendre maintenant, la compagnie Circus Fœtus prépare sa première création. Or cirque ouvre la toile d'un chapiteau métaphysique où le cirque retrouve sa grandiloquence brillante, s'effrite doucement, disparaît pour mieux reparaître encore. Thomas Saulgrain (France) et Alma Buholzer (Canada) en sont les deux interprètes et créateurs, et seront assistés dans leur démarche par Peter James et Nicolas Cantin.

Hello,

As you might already know, the company Circus Fœtus is currently preparing its first creation. Or cirque is a voyage into the origins of circus, both historical and visceral. It searches for the splendour of the circus on an intimate scale, gently deconstructing its illusions to better rediscover them. Thomas Saulgrain (France) and Alma Buholzer (Canada) are the creators and performers and will be assisted in their journey by Peter James and Nicolas Cantin. 



Nous avons quasiment bouclé notre planning de création pour que cette pièce de cirque soit visible dès Janvier 2015. En Février dernier ce sont donc près de 100 jours de travail qui ont commencés et qui nous feront passer par des lieux comme Les Migrateurs (Strasbourg), Espace Catastrophe (Bruxelles), Théâtre Dommelhof (pour la semaine de sélection du programme Circus Next), Le Théâtre sans Fil (Montréal) ainsi que le Festival Montréal Complètement Cirque, CIRCa - pôle national des arts du cirque (Auch), La Cité Marcel Marceau (Le Mans) et sans doute encore d'autres.

We have nearly finalized our creation planning in order for this circus piece to start playing in January 2015.  Last February marked the beginning of almost 100 days of work on the piece, which will take us to places like Les Migrateurs (Strasbourg), Espace Catastrophe (Brussels), Théâtre Dommelhof (for the selection week of the Circus Next program), Le Théâtre sans Fil (Montreal), Festival Montréal Complètement Cirque, CIRCa - pôle national des arts du cirque (Auch, France), La Cité Marcel Marceau (Le Mans, France) and certainly a few others.


Pour remettre cette campagne dans un contexte financier, le budget prévisionnel total de la production s'élève à 80 000 euros, divisés de la sorte: 

In order to financialy contextualise this crowdfunding, the total provisional budget of the production is 80 000 euros, divided as shown here:


Or cirque étant le premier projet de la compagnie, nous ne pouvons pas nous appuyer sur des recettes passées pour supporter cet investissement. Mais alors, qui finance ?

Or cirque being the company's very first project, we can't use previous incomes to support this investment. So, where are the funds coming from? 



Vous pouvez aider Or cirque sur quelques points précis:            

Prise en charge des techniciens lumière et son (période finale de la création). 3 000 euros (comprenant frais de déplacement et charges sociales). Prise en charge de l'intervention d'un dramaturge sur 3 semaines. 3 200 euros (comprenant frais de déplacement et charges sociales). Vol aller/retour Paris-Montréal pour Thomas pour notre résidence de Juin-Juillet et notre participation au Festival Montréal Complètement Cirque. 800 euros (La bourse du CALQ qu'Alma a reçu a pu nous permettre de couvrir une bonne partie des frais, allant de la location du studio jusqu'à la prise en charge des collaborateurs artistiques). L'achat d'une barre d'écartement adaptée aux vols internationaux. 100 euros.

Total: 7 100 euros

Il faut ajouter à cela les frais du site Indiegogo et vous avez notre objectif pour cette campagne.


You can help Or cirque on some specific points:

Sound and lighting technicians (final period of the creation). 3 000 euros (including travel fees and social charges). A three week period with a dramaturg. 3 200 euros (including travel fees and social charges). Return flight Paris-Montreal for Thomas for our June-July residency and our presentation during "Montreal Complètement Cirque" festival. 800 euros (the grant Alma received from the Quebec Government allowed us to cover most of the fees, such as the studio rental and the artistic collaborators). The purchase of a trapeze suspension bar suited for international flights. 100 euros.

Total: 7 100 euros

Adding Indiegogo's fees, you have the total goal of our crowdfunding campaign.

N'hésitez pas à visitez notre site si vous voulez plus d'information sur le projet ou à nous poser vos questions à ciecircusfoetus@gmail.com. N'hésitez pas non plus à partager cette page si vous voulez nous soutenir. Et enfin n'hésitez pas à faire un investissement dans la compagnie Circus Fœtus, suivant votre budget bien entendu. 

Don't hesitate to visit our website if you would like more information on the project, or to ask us questions at ciecircusfoetus@gmail.com. Don't hesitate either to share this crowdfunding page if you want to support us, and finally don't hesitate to make an investment in the company Circus Fœtus, depending on your budget naturally.

Merci à vous.

Many thanks.

Or cirqueBonjour, comme vous le savez peut-être, ou comme vous allez l'apprendre maintenant, la compagnie Circus Fœtus prépare sa première création. Or cirque ouvre la toile d'un chapiteau métaphysique où le cirque retrouve sa grandiloquence brillante, s'effrite doucement, disparaît pour mieux reparaître encore. Thomas Saulgrain (France) et Alma Buholzer (Canada) en sont les deux interprètes et créateurs, et seront assistés dans leur démarche par Peter James et Nicolas Cantin. Hello,As you might already know, the company Circus Fœtus is currently preparing its first creation. Or cirque is a voyage into the origins of circus, both historical and visceral. It searches for the splendour of the circus on an intimate scale, gently deconstructing its illusions to better rediscover them. Thomas Saulgrain (France) and Alma Buholzer (Canada) are the creators and performers and will be assisted in their journey by Peter James and Nicolas Cantin.  Nous avons quasiment bouclé notre planning de création pour que cette pièce de cirque soit visible dès Janvier 2015. En Février dernier ce sont donc près de 100 jours de travail qui ont commencés et qui nous feront passer par des lieux comme Les Migrateurs (Strasbourg), Espace Catastrophe (Bruxelles), Théâtre Dommelhof (pour la semaine de sélection du programme Circus Next), Le Théâtre sans Fil (Montréal) ainsi que le Festival Montréal Complètement Cirque, CIRCa - pôle national des arts du cirque (Auch), La Cité Marcel Marceau (Le Mans) et sans doute encore d'autres. We have nearly finalized our creation planning in order for this circus piece to start playing in January 2015.  Last February marked the beginning of almost 100 days of work on the piece, which will take us to places like Les Migrateurs (Strasbourg), Espace Catastrophe (Brussels), Théâtre 
Dommelhof (for the selection week of the Circus Next program), Le 
Théâtre sans Fil (Montreal), Festival Montréal Complètement 
Cirque, CIRCa - pôle national des arts du cirque (Auch, France), La Cité Marcel 
Marceau (Le Mans, France) and certainly a few others. Pour remettre cette campagne dans un contexte financier, le budget prévisionnel total de la production s'élève à 80 000 euros, divisés de la sorte: In order to financialy contextualise this crowdfunding, the total provisional budget of the production is 80 000 euros, divided as shown here:Or cirque étant le premier projet de la compagnie, nous ne pouvons pas nous appuyer sur des recettes passées pour supporter cet investissement. Mais alors, qui finance ? Or cirque being the company's very first project, we can't use previous incomes to support this investment. So, where are the funds coming from? 
Vous
pouvez aider Or cirque sur quelques points précis:            Prise
en charge des techniciens lumière et son (période finale de la création). 3 000
euros (comprenant frais de déplacement et
charges sociales). Prise
en charge de l'intervention d'un dramaturge sur 3 semaines. 3 200
euros (comprenant frais de déplacement et
charges sociales). Vol aller/retour Paris-Montréal pour Thomas pour notre résidence de Juin-Juillet et notre participation au Festival Montréal Complètement Cirque. 800
euros (La bourse du CALQ qu'Alma a reçu a pu nous
permettre de couvrir une bonne partie des frais, allant de la location du
studio jusqu'à la prise en charge des collaborateurs artistiques). L'achat
d'une barre d'écartement adaptée aux vols internationaux. 100
euros.
Total:
7 100 euros
Il faut ajouter à cela les frais du site Indiegogo et vous avez notre objectif pour cette campagne. You can help Or cirque on some specific points: 
Sound and lighting technicians (final period of the creation). 3 000 euros (including travel fees and social charges). A three week period with a dramaturg. 3 200 euros (including travel fees and social charges). Return flight Paris-Montreal for Thomas for our June-July residency and our presentation during "Montreal Complètement Cirque" festival. 800 euros (the grant Alma received from the Quebec Government allowed us to cover most of the fees, such as the studio rental and the artistic collaborators). The purchase of a trapeze suspension bar suited for international flights. 100 euros.Total: 7 100 eurosAdding Indiegogo's fees, you have the total goal of our crowdfunding campaign.N'hésitez pas à visitez notre site si vous voulez plus d'information sur le projet ou à nous poser vos questions à ciecircusfoetus@gmail.com. N'hésitez pas non plus à partager cette page si vous voulez nous soutenir. Et enfin n'hésitez pas à faire un investissement dans la compagnie Circus Fœtus, suivant votre budget bien entendu. Don't hesitate to visit our website if you would like more information on the project, or to ask us questions at ciecircusfoetus@gmail.com. Don't hesitate either to share this crowdfunding page if you want to support us, and finally don't hesitate to make an investment in the company Circus Fœtus, depending on your budget naturally. Merci à vous.Many thanks.

story:
Persephone Theatre Project and Off The Grid Theatre Company Present Charlotte Perkins Gilman's The Yellow Wallpaper

My name is Christopher Webb. I've been working in professional theatre for almost 20 years now, and in that time I've come to learn that creating new work is what will keep this art form alive and well long past my life, or the life of my children. Six years ago my wife, Jessica Webb, expressed a desire to transform Charlotte Perkins Gilman's story The Yellow Wallpaper into a stage play. We kept dreaming about the possibility but never made it a reality, until now. Three years ago a young artist named Alexis Scheer entered my classroom at The Boston Conservatory and we began a mentorship that has led to her creating her own company, Off The Grid, and the two of us producing this new piece of theatre. We aren't asking for much, $2500. This is a workshop of a new play, one that will hopefully have a long and successful life beyond this summer. But we need your help to make this workshop happen. 

What We Need & What You Get

Off The Grid has already been awarded a grant from The Boston Conservatory to help with our funding. Boston Playwrights' Theatre has awarded us a Black Box Fellowship which allows us a space to rehearse and perform. But we need just a little bit more help to defray the costs of paying our artists. I believe that  we should be able to pay any artist willing to give their time and artistry to this project, but we can't do that without your help. As a thank you, we will be offering private Alexander Technique Lessons, Photography Sessions, In-Home Wine Tastings, In-Home Meal Preparations, as well as producer credits and signed memorabilia from the play. Every person who contributes, at any level, will receive a thank-you in the program.

Your Impact

We are hoping to provide performances specifically for LGBTQ youth outreach programs, young theatre artist education programs, and high school English programs. Having produced very successful school tours with a reputable professional theatre in town, I'm confidant that this piece speaks to an audience that isn't currently being served. Also, in a field and age where Gender Parity is prevalent, your funding would help bring to the stage a piece written by, starring, designed by, and based on source material written by women.   

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times are tough economically. If you can't help out by donating here, please spread the word about this campaign. Check out our producing partners at www.offthegridtheatre.com. Contact us at persephonetheatrepjct@gmail.com for other ways you can get involved in this production. And please come to see the show May 16-25 at Boston Playwrights' Theatre, 949 Commonwealth Ave.

story:
Our Story

After meeting and working together at NYU and the Stella Adler Studio, Stacy Osei-Kuffour and Michael Sutherland have continued the partnership by producing, co-directing and performing Stacy's original plays.  We have strived to perform work with socially relevant ideas, and the plays have looked at themes of race and gender identity and serve to really put out important and provocative thoughts.  The most recent project, The Painter, was a finalist in the 2011 Samuel French OOB festival, (13 out 1000+) which Exeunt magazine called "a powerful and suspenseful drama"  (7/27/11).  Previous work together includes an earlier workshop of Breathless at the Downtown Urban Theater Festival, The Painter at the Strawberry Festival, a reading of Red Red with On the Square Productions, and In the Evening at the Stella Adler Studio.  


http://offoffbroadway.broadwayworld.com/article...

The Impact

Breathless is a look at race in current America.  Seen from the point of view of a white wannabe thug, and a proper suburban black woman together on a train, we reverse the stereotypes and bring up questions of culture, and what it is that makes us all human.  It's play that comes from the heart for us, and we feel is really important for people to see.  We've been given a great opportunity by the Dream Up festival, to have the Johnson Theater at Theater for the New City, where we can reach a larger audience than we've had in the past.  This is play where we can really engage perceptions and prejudice and hopefully make an impact on a controversial topic that needs to be addressed.  

"This is a beautiful play, that starts with a shocking reversal, proceeds through real terror, and arrives at an
unexpected beauty.  A beautifully written two-character adventure, played by two wonderful actors."

-Austin Pendleton, award-winning actor, director and playwright

What We Need & What You Get

Until now every show we've done has come out of our own pockets and the set and props out of our apartments.  This is obviously a strain on two young actors, and everything raised here will help.  Specifically we have to cover the costs of the festival rental/participation fee, acquiring costumes and props, to offer compensation to members of the team we need to hire to run lights and sound, stage manage, and to print materials such as postcards to help spread the word about the show. 

Obviously this is a tough time economically, but raising funds here ensures that we can continue to move forward doing plays that try to make a difference.  Through generous help from friends, we've been able to come up with some great rewards help us say thank you.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to others you know through facebook, twitter and even google+!  Though the show happens in New York, supporting the theatre is important everywhere.  Pass it along and keep real theatre alive.  

Breathless
Johnson Theater, Theater for the New City
$12
September 1 9pm
September 2 7pm 
September 3 7pm
September 4 5pm and 7pm

Tickets available at: http://www.smarttix.com/show.aspx?showcode=BRE1...

Or (212) 868 4444

story:
4th Annual:  Fallen Heroes, Rising Stars: A Juneteenth Celebration Through Dance                   Contributions are Tax Deductible!  

 

www.GrownWomenDance.org

GWDC is fiscally sponsored by Dancers Group

Tickets: http://willowstheatre.com/Shows/specialevents.html 

 

Who We Are & What We Do

Grown Women Dance Collective was formed to create a positive and nurturing environment for mature, female dancers to create beautiful work that is relevant and accessible to diverse audiences. It was founded in 2009 by four long- term friends, most of whom met at the Ailey School over twenty years ago. Three of the women are over forty, one is over thirty, all are of culturally diverse backgrounds, have danced professionally in either New York or Northern California throughout their careers, and continue to teach and perform.  We seek to bridge the older generation with the younger generation, and the usually "non dance attending" audience with concert dance, in order to pass on both artistic and cultural knowledge.

We are really excited to bring the arts and cross culturalism to Contra Costa County! The concert is a family- friendly, uplifting and inspiring evening of dance, music and American history.

Junteenth celebrates African American liberation from slavery. The tradition dates back to June 19th, 1865, when enslaved people in Texas were informed by Union soldiers that slavery had "ended". This jubilant news, at last being supported by the Union Army's reinforcement of the law, came two and a half years after President Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclamation. The holiday is about celebrating African American freedom, while encouraging self-development and respect for all cultures.

Our project honors 35 African American musical artists that have died since the year 2000 through dance and multimedia. The concert opens with a welcome speech about Juneteenth and its cultural significance. The show closes with an African American history montage set to James Brown's "Living In America".

Grown Women Dance Collective:  Tonya Marie Amos (Dances Luther Vandross), Marisa Castillo (Dances Lena Horne), Michelle Ned (Dances Michael Jackson).
 
Guests artists:  Mindy Haywood (New York, Dances Ray Charles & James Brown), Aliyah Hassan (San Diego, Dances Run DMC en pointe), Elayne Jones (Walnut Creek, First African American to play for the Metropolitan Opera plays timpani), Daniel Marshall (San Diego, Dances Run DMC), Jessica Raaum (Walnut Creek, Sings Amazing Grace), Aundrea Seidel (Mexico, Dances Whitney Houston en pointe).

This is our 4th annual concert and is truly bridge building in the community. We present this work in Contra Costa County because there is very little cultural diversity and less exposure to the arts than in many other parts of the Bay Area. Through the arts, we have a huge opportunity to change people's awareness and impact cross cultural relations.  It's amazing to see that after the first hour of experiencing this work together, perfect strangers of different races and backgrounds start excitedly talking to one another, sharing stories and hugging each other in the theater!
 
We're motivated to produce art and Black History programs in the public schools next year.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are $11,000 short of funding for our upcoming concert.

Our very low ticket price ($20) helps make the concert accessible to low income folks.  The break even price is over $100 a seat, so we need sponsorships to continue to impact people that have never had the opportunity to experiencet concert dance.

If we hit our goal:  All monies (tax deductable) will directly pay all artists involved in the process including dancers, choreographers and musicians, tech people, lighting designer, stage manager, rehearsal space, video and photo documentation, and 3 days theater rental to produce a dynamic and uplifting show.  We can continue on our path to bringing the arts to diverse communities and we can begin an arts education program in the public schools next year.

If we don't hit our goal:  The show must go on!  We are determined to bring cross cultural arts to Contra Costa County.  The theater has been booked, ariline tickets have been purchased, we're intensively into rehearsals, PSA's are being played on the radio startions.  We're artists, we're creative, right?

  

The Impact

Your Tax Deductible contributions will help:

Bring people of all different backgrounds, races, and economic groups into one space to learn, share and grow.  

Build cross cultural and cross generational bridges.  

Expose low income communities and children to concert dance.  

Educate about African American struggle and triumph.

Highlight some of the joy and common experiences that we all share as Americans.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends!  Please post on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Email your friends, family and lovers of the arts, education, history and cross-culturalism.   You can also use the Indiegogo share tools.   Please let them know that their contribution is Tax Deductible and how much we'd appreciate their support!

story:
What is Theatre Seven of Chicago?

We are a theatre company entering our seventh season. Our work explores the diverse life of our city and attempts to tell the Chicago story from as many perspectives as possible. Since 2007, our sixteen productions have been seen by 12,000 audience members, been nominated for 3 Jeff Awards and 2 Black Theatre Alliance Awards and earned the company the 2012 Emerging Theatre Award from Broadway in Chicago.

 

I Am An Artist

Theatre Seven's extended family of artists represents a diverse, talented community of over 250 of Chicago's best and brightest theatrical artists. This summer, we gathered some of our favorite collaborators to talk about their lives, their hopes, their crafts, their dreams. This project is the result of those conversations - a campaign to honor, celebrate, and continue supporting the brilliant array of artists that work on our stages.

 

What is Artist-Supportive?

What does it mean when we say we believe in creating artist-supportive experiences? It means we believe artists deserve to be paid for their work. It means we believe artists succeed when an institution has the time and resources to fully support their efforts. It means we believe that if Chicago's best young actors, directors and designers are given a safe space, the right tools, and as much compensation as we afford to offer...magical things will happen. And Chicago will benefit.

 

Why Now?

As we approach the end of our fiscal year (Aug 31), we want to finish the year strong to ensure we can continue supporting artists to the degree we have in past years. In 2012-13, we undertake an ambitious four production season, which will include a production at the Steppenwolf Garage and a year-long short play festival about extraordinary Chicago women. It is important that we finish this fiscal year strong so that, in planning for future seasons, we are able to continue offering the utmost support to the artists whose work brings our visions to life.

 

What's In It For You

Donations of any size come with cool perks, anything from a personalized Facebook status to a subscription for 2 to our ridiculously awesome upcoming season. But the most important thing you get with a donation is knowing that YOU helped support artists today. When you donate to Theatre Seven, you can be assured that every dollar goes to support an organization that is shaping the future of Chicago theatre, by both supporting the city's finest artists and bringing their work to life.

 

Nuts and Bolts

Theatre Seven IS a 501(c)3 charity in the state of Illinois. Every donation to thsi campaign is tax-deductible in accordance with the laws where you maintain residence, and will be issued a written thank you within a month of donation and a year end tax receipt from Theatre Seven.

 

How Else You Can Help

Spread the word. See a show. Subscribe to our next season. Think good thoughts. Do something to save the world. Love Chicago. Support an artist today.

story:
Hello puppet pals,

Michael Rosenbaum here, creator of the puppet improv group “Puppet Mayhem”, which is an Improv show with a kid’s show format, but for adults (like avenue Q). There are puppets and humans interacting with each other. Teaching life lessons, learning the letter of the day, how to count, singing songs, and meeting special guests in the same cheery demeanor as Sesame Street, but geared towards adults.

Why we need your help

Puppet mayhem has entered into the Hollywood fringe festival, which is an exciting festival held every year in june to celebrate the performing arts.

We are taking part in the celebration by performing our show for three days in the festival. We'll be perfoiming at the prestigious improv theater iOWEST in hollywood on June 15th-17th.

To make this possible we are raising $1,500. This will help cover costs for the theater, marketing tools, and gas (the team is based in orange county, an hour from LA).

For helping us our puppet gang will rejoice, and give you some awesome perks.

$10 gets you a personnel puppet video greeting from one of our puppet pals.

$20 gets you a cartoon of yourself in puppet form.

$50 gets you a cool "Puppet Mayhem" t-shirt with our logo on it. 

$100 gets you 2 tickets to the show.

$250 you'll get a private lesson in puppetry from me personally.

$500 you will get a custom puppet of your very own.

$1,000 our puppet gang will treat you to lunch, or dinner (your choice), and treat you to a show just for you, family, and friends. 

Some of these are limited.

Once you donated, e-mail us at puppetmayhem@gmail.com to tell us a little bit about you for your personal puppet video greeting, and give us a picture for your caricature.

help us with puppet world domination

If you like what we're about, but can't donate... please help us spread the puppet word on facebook, twitter, and any where else. .

Also...

If we raise more then our plan, the rest will go to "Relay For Life". 

Please help make this possible. PUPPET CHEER!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
project1979 is bringing the Generation X/Y people together with laughter-evoking social commentary and real life stories of how we grew up alongside computers and remember the night the Berlin Wall came down. I am inspired by my generation and am proud of who we are, where we've been and what we are on are way to doing.

We have 5 hours until the campaign closes. Please consider donating $5 to help make it happen.

By contributing to this IndieGoGo campaign, you will become shareholders in an unprecedented artistic undertaking.

project1979 is creating an authentic portrait of the lives of the 30-something popolation using social media to create new bonds and a sense of community thriving on diversity.

10% of all proceeds will go towards The Battle We Didn’t Choose and a rotating charity chosen by project1979’s community.

story:
About Recovery

Ten years ago, I started writing a play about two people I'd met while undergoing treatment for leukemia. Though they'd never met, I imagined what it would be like if leukemia had become a catalyst for them to forge a new, meaningful connections, question the essential meaning of life, and fall in love--despite the odds.

After successful runs in New York City and Minneapolis, Recovery now heads to Washington D.C. as an official selection of the 2013 Capital Fringe Festival. Here is a sampling of what critics and audiences have said about Recovery so far:

“Recovery stands out strongly as an authentic
piece of theater clearly written from the heart, 
armed with courage and a contagious sense of humor
to confront even the most challenging situations.”
        -- Show Business Weekly

“Quirky, edgy material told with unflinching
honesty and moving moments.”
       --backstage

“Poignant, profound, compelling...
Recovery has authenticity.
This production  reminds you that plays
are not mass-produced commodities.”
--Curtain Up

“Recovery has a great raw emotional,
universal quality. I was very moved.”
--nytheatre.com

“Beautifully written, Recovery is a poignant and
thoughtful exploration 
of life and death, relationships, and hope.
--Cherry and spoon.com

"“Married to a cancer survivor, we were both
hesitant to see a show about leukemia. 
 We got the courage to go see the show,
and we both are refreshed with strength and courage!
 This wonderfully written play left
us gasping for air, and feeling, hopeful, grateful, 
fearless, and even more in love. Thank you Recovery.”
 
“This show was amazing! It was beautifully written
and still very funny. The show is not a downer
like one might assume a show about cancer would be. 
Rather, it was filled with hope and authenticity."
 
Since I'm producing this show on my own, your help will lend an incredible amount of support, assisting with a variety of costs, including:
--Transportation for the playwright from New York City to Washington
--Rehearsal space (which ranges from $500-$1000, in itself)
--Payment to actors, director, and other production staff
--Marketing, printing and copying costs
 
I am incredibly grateful to any amount you can spare, and thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support! For more information on this play, please vist: http://www.markjasonwilliams.com/recovery.html

We Need Your Help!

In order to pay for the set and props necessary for the production of this moving piece, we need your help! any donation is welcome big or small. if you cant donate, PLEASE SHARE! help us reach our goal and bring our vision to life! 

Feel Free to...

Share this link

Get the word out! share with #agirlswork and be sure to donate!

Please email Jordan.johnston@purchase.edu for set, prop, and costume donations. anything helps and we will see you soon!

story:
We are excited to announce our collaboration with Curious Frog Theatre Company! Please check out our Gallery for more infomartion on this Non-Profit Collaboration. 

"Curious Frog Theatre Company is thrilled to collaborate with DiMay productions on this show.  Curious Frog's mission is to present new, modern and classical works with the goal of showing a new, multicultural perspective through non-traditional casting that does not hinder understanding or believing a work, but rather enhances the work in an innovative manner and fosters fresh perceptions."

Our Story

DiMay Productions is a multiplatform production company created by DIana Sanchez and MAYlin Castro, which promotes multimedia projects that are Bold, Innovative and outside the box. Embracing multicultural artists and characters beyond stereotypes. DiMay has given us the opportunity, as artists, of having our voices heard. We are creating a space that fights against the norm. 

 

Our latest venture, is bringing to the Stage 2 Sisters and a Piano by Nilo Cruz, -Nilo Cruz’s play Two Sisters and a Piano takes place in Havana Cuba.  Two sisters are living in an old Colonial home, on House arrest from the government.  The first sister, Marìa Celia, is a writer that published works that led to the two sisters’ imprisonment.   The second sister, Sofia, is frustrated with their arrangement and places blame for the situation on her sister.  Lieutenant Portuondo is the government official assigned to their case, and he takes romantic interest in Marìa Celia.  Through poetic dialogue, the two sisters explore the ideas of revolution and stay strong in their belief to support their forbidden ideals.

 

Look out for 2 Sisters at a Theater near you!!

 

The Impact

It is our deeply held belief to give power back to the artist. We believe that all artists should have a say in what they put out into the world, and this is what DiMay is all about. We each have a journey which is colored by our ideals and beliefs.

We see what is being fed to us in the industry and DiMay Productions is taking a stand by having an inclusive casting process, what we want to see is what we see out in the real world all colors, all backgrounds, all faiths interconnected beyond stereotypes, and "ideas", but rather an interconnectedness, within these human stories.

What makes our lives more interesting are our stories, and that is what we hope to promote. A multicultural story that affects many, and excludes no one.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal is $10,000

Two Sisters and a Piano is a beautiful story about forbidden loves, freedom, imprisonment, and yearning. We stand by the ideal of making this the way it was meant to be made, and for that we are reaching for the goal of $10,000, no amount is too small or too big. We know we can reach it if we all gather together and make it happen.

All donations will go directly to fund the production.

 (Set Up Costs, Props, Rental/Rehearsal Space, Artist Fees, Promotion, Rights to Play)

We are excited to announce our collaboration with Curious Frog Theatre Company! Please check out our Gallery for more infomartion on this Non-Profit Collaboration.

story:
Our Story

Monkey Wrench Collective is a non-profit So Cal theater company formed from the ashes of the enormously successful Rude Guerrilla. Devoted to US premieres of provocative work from the UK and Canada, the small troupe is led by Artistic Director Dave Barton and Producing Director Bryan Jennings.
After 15 years of producing some of the very best avante-garde work available, Monkey Wrench Collective has been given the unique opportunity to revive their critically-acclaimed US premiere of playwright Mark Ravenhill’s “pool (no water)” on South Coast Repertory’s Nicholas Studio in May 2012.
A five-week LA run will follow a couple of weeks later.
“Pool” follows a group of artists gathered at the home of a photographer friend far more successful than they are. Their complex love/hate relationship with her erupts into chaos when she becomes injured in an accident.
Gathering at her bedside, they gaze down at her unconscious body and decide to use her suffering as their next art project.
Here are a sampling of reviewer quotes about our first production:

"This bold and uncompromising effort resembles a work of modern dance that is striking in design and execution." --Jordan Young, OC/LA Arts Examiner

"A kinetic, lively and engaging production, carefully choreographed and infused with music. The cast is a well-oiled ensemble that never misses a beat."--Rick Stein, Spark O.C.

"This horde of green-eyed malcontents should be very familiar to us (maybe even include us), as it unleashes a maelstrom of ugliness so potent that it seeps into your marrow." --Stacy Davies, OC Weekly

" 'pool' has the look and feel of the best small indie filmamkers. It has a tone that's lightly ironic, reflecting a puckish sensibility; in others, its mixture of colored lights, amped sound and vicious action yield a feeling of psychedelia."  --Eric Marchese, OC Register




The Impact

This is a great opportunity for Monkey Wrench Collective  to branch out from the limitations of storefront theatre, taking the conventions of intimate theater--passion, immediacy, a wider scope of material and an embrace of artistic concerns over commercial ones--and play to larger (and vastly different) audiences.
We've re-assembled the original, talented cast and designers, booked the theaters and budgeted for sets, props, costumes, video, rent, rehearsal space, publicity, actor and designer stipends and transportation. It's going to be costly, but we have only one chance to do this and we want to do it right.

How will your donation help us?

$5,000.00 pays our theater rent, insurance rider and valet parking.
$3,000.00 covers our set construction materials, costumes and props.
$2,000.00 covers our dance rehearsal space.
$1,500.00 covers our postcards, postcard postage and prints our programs.
$1,500.00 pays our artists Actor's Equity minimum for the run of the show.
$1,000.00 covers a publicist, posters, t-shirts and theater signage.
$1,000.00 pays our board ops, stage managers, video, costume, scenic and lighting designers.

Because this is a labor of love, Bryan and Dave aren't taking any compensation for their work.

What do you get for handing over your hard-earned cash? Personalized perks, a tax write-off (because we're a 501c3 non-profit), our grateful thanks and the knowledge that you are helping enrich the artistic community in Orange County and LA by supporting new, adventurous work.

While the first perks listed are only available to those donating a minimum of $25.00, we welcome any donation that you can afford. If you can't help out financially at this point in time, please share our link with anyone that you think might be able to help us. 

We need everyone's help to make our goals. No action (or donation) is too small.

story:
Hello! My name is Ben King and I am a contemporary dancer. I have been given the opportunity to train at Trinity Laban Conservatoire for Music and Dance, an internationally established conservatoire that trains contemporary dancers to the highest level.

The last 3 years of my life have been focused on becoming a professional dancer. Having NO contemporary dance experience I auditioned for Northern School of Contemporary Dance, I was unsuccessful. So for a year I worked in a bar and spent my free time developing my abilities when I successfully auditioned for a place at The Scottish School of Contemporary Dance. I have been training here for 2 years and with only £3500 of support from Student Finance England over the full two years, I have worked to support myself and pay my tuition fees. I have worked incredibly hard to develop myself as a dancer and want to continue this in London.

I want to study at Trinity Laban because it holds a WORLD CLASS reputation for training professional dancers. The school is multicultural with students from all over the world travelling to be part of it. The BA (hons) Contemporary Dance course has some of the leading lecturers in the country. I will be able to learn a lot from these teachers and their wealth of experience will help me to become a strong and versatile dancer.

I give you my word that your investment in me will be worthwhile. I hope you will make a pledge, however large or small. Absolutely anything you can contribute will help me to fund my studies. Please also consider sharing my cause on facebook or twitter and encouraging your friends or anyone who might be interested, to check out my campaign.

Thank you so much for your time!

Sincerely,
Ben

story:
2Cents Theatre Group, in residence at the Hudson Theatres, is thrilled to be producing our first official Mainstage Production!

 

We are a new theater company in Los Angeles, and have decided to start off with a bang by doing RENT, by Jonathan Larson. This piece won a Tony Award for Best Musical in 1996, and was groundbreaking and "the first of its kind", when it hit the stage. We decided to make RENT our first official Mainstage Production, because it has had a massive and personal impact on so many people. The late Jonathan Larson wrote it to bring light to the AIDS epidemic that was so prominent in New York in the 80's, and to tell the stories of struggling yet passionate artists, many of whom were outcasts in one way or another. Most people who see this show, see a version of themselves in at least one of the very colorful characters in this ensemble piece. Everyone in our company and cast is passionate about this piece, and we hope you will be too!

We have also established partnerships with AIDS Project LA (APLA), Being Alive, and AIDS Research Alliance (ARA), which are all local organizations that provide AIDS research and support, and we are working on a few more local partnerships, where some proceeds from our ticket sales will go to supporting those causes. RENT is a massive undertaking because it demands high quality in sound equipment, set design and construction, costumes and props, lighting design and equipment, music, etc., and we are determined to bring Jonathan Larson's story to life thoroughly and completely!

We are also putting up a second production that will run simultaneously, twice a week, during the run of RENT. That production is going to be Steven Dietz's PRIVATE EYES. This is a very intelligent, hilarious, dark comedy that will run on Thursday nights and Saturday matinees, every week that RENT is running, as a sister-production.

Therefore, we are doing a three-part indiegogo campaign, and there will be special perks for donating to all three campaigns. This is the first leg, and we are looking to raise $2000 for our initial production costs, i.e. theater rental, royalties, and paying our top-notch production staff. But let's try and surpass that, and get our next two campaigns going before they even start! Any and all contributions are much appreciated, and there will be perks like free tickets to the shows, and some to our opening night reception and gala, free refreshments at the theater, posters and programs signed by the cast, tickets to our fall show, and even getting your name spray painted on our set!

If we do not make our goal, a larger portion of what we do raise is witheld from us, so it's very important that we reach it! If it is not possible for you to contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word. Sharing this event on Facebook, twitter, and telling your community about us in whatever way you can, helps out too! 

Plese check out our website at www.kboulepictures.com to read reviews of our last show, The Last Five Years, and to find out more about our company. And help us bring these powerful pieces of theater to life.

No day but today.

This is the first leg, and we are looking to raise $2000 for our initial production costs, i.e. theater rental, royalties, and paying our top-notch production staff. But let's try and surpass that, and get our next two campaigns going before they even start! Any and all contributions are much appreciated, and there will be perks like free tickets to the shows, and some to our opening night reception and gala, free refreshments at the theater, posters and programs signed by the cast, tickets to our fall show, and even getting your name spray painted on our set!
If we do not make our goal, a larger portion of what we do raise is witheld from us, so it's very important that we reach it! If it is not possible for you to contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word. Sharing this event on Facebook, twitter, and telling your community about us in whatever way you can, helps out too! 
Plese check out our website at www.kboulepictures.com to read reviews of our last show, The Last Five Years, and to find out more about our company. And help us bring these powerful pieces of theater to life.
No day but today.

story:
Hello Wonderful world of art lovers, supporters and fans. I’m Ursula Kendall and I am an Atlanta Based Artist in the medium of Dance. I come from a unique blend of instructors, mentors and supporters who love the energy I bring forth to the stage. I graduated with Magnet honors at Tri-Cities High School in East Point, Ga. I studied under Diane Sales, Roscoe Sales and Dawn Axam to name a few. I have had the privilege to audition and awarded partial scholarship from the late Denise Jefferson at the Alvin Ailey School in NY at a very young age, that fueled my passion and direction as a professional Dancer, Choreographer and Arts Activist today.

What is SHE Created IT? and why is SHE, so important to me?

SHE Created It started as platform to showcase female choreographers in Atlanta as a movement to put female artists like myself on atlanta’s arts map. It allowed us to share our stories through creative ideas, concepts and most imortantly, our own eyes. As SHE began to form, I learned that their were more female artists worldwide searching for an outlet to share their stories and given an opportunity to present great works on it's higher production level. I understood where they were coming from personally, and I wanted to be one of many women to share my talents with in creating a great space for female artists like myself.

Your contributions will help support 5 women to present their works which includes: rehearsal spacing, artists fees, lighting and sound support, little promotion and marketing.

The contribution also goes towards servicing the community with dance and dance-related art workshops from local female instructors who weren’t able to showcase works, but were able to give their time in instructing ages from toddlers to adults of all levels of dance supporting our movement in creating an sister-hood supported environment.

In which we give back the love with a Round Table discussion called Woman 2 Women Talk Back Brunch to evaluate and connect artistically in helping support women in the arts.

5 Dynamic Diva's of Dance for SHE Created IT.

Maria Bauman NY, NY
Heidi Echols, Winston-Salem, NC
Robin M. Gee Greensboro, NC
Kim Jones Charlotte, NC
Tianna P. Sykes Atlanta, Georgia

Special performances by Ursula Kendall & dancers.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $3000.00 donated funds which cover costs of all artists which includes dancers choreographer, hostess, sound and lighting techs, stage managers, flyers/posters, and flooring.

It is a blessing to receive and sponsored majorly from the oldest women’s college, Salem College in Winston-Salem, NC and allowing us to use their theaters, dance rooms, gyms, students and staff support to bring this unity of Female Artist Collaboration together along with its community. And as we know in the arts there is more work to be done always and this is why we are reaching back in our community of friends, families, and fans to support those who have put in so much time and effort to commit and dedicate their talents for all women in the arts.

Donating to our project whether you are right next door in winston-salem or in another state we as artists pledge to bring the joy we have on stage right to your door with special thank you’s SHE Created IT collectibles from T-Shirts, Tickets, Special Edition SHE Photos, Video Updates and more.

If we do not reach our goal, Well we will just say that we will, because we know in our hearts we are doing a great thing all around.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get involved and Spread The word even its just a mention on Facebook Twitter or LinkedIn. 

Another way you may help us get the word out is becoming a member on our mailing list so when we send updates you can easily forward it over.
